features.featureDescription: Service supports disabling public network access either through using service-level IP ACL filtering rule (not NSG or Azure Firewall) or using a 'Disable Public Network Access' toggle switch.
features.featureGuidance: No additional configurations are required as this is enabled on a default deployment.
features.customerActionsDescription: Secure cloud native services with network controls

features.featureDescription: Service native IP filtering capability for filtering network traffic (not to be confused with NSG or Azure Firewall).
features.featureGuidance: Deploy private endpoints for all Azure resources that support the Private Link feature, to establish a private access point for the resources.
features.customerActionsDescription: Secure cloud native services with network controls

automatedPolicyAvailability.policyName: Private endpoint should be enabled for MariaDB servers
automatedPolicyAvailability.policyDescription: Private endpoint connections enforce secure communication by enabling private connectivity to Azure Database for MariaDB. Configure a private endpoint connection to enable access to traffic coming only from known networks and prevent access from all other IP addresses, including within Azure.

automatedPolicyAvailability.policyName: Public network access should be disabled for MariaDB servers
automatedPolicyAvailability.policyDescription: Disable the public network access property to improve security and ensure your Azure Database for MariaDB can only be accessed from a private endpoint. This configuration strictly disables access from any public address space outside of Azure IP range, and denies all logins that match IP or virtual network-based firewall rules.
